comment.author: 34271692@N02
comment._content:
Nordlandskatedralen is not "still standing", Bodø Domkirke however is built at its spot.

Almost all of Bdø was bombed by the germans at may 27th 1940, leaving only a few bulidings standing.

comment.author: 8163660@N03
comment._content:
This is taken by one of Bodø's first professional photographers. Her name was Louise Engen (1873-1947), and she grew up on a farm called Jensvoll - just a few kilometers outside today's city center. 

She got her photography education in Oslo, England and USA before returning to Bodø.

The local museum here in Bodø has got a copy of this photo as well, and states that it's taken somewhere between 1900 and 1940.

I think this photo was taken from the island "Store Hjertøya" late July, between 6 and 8 PM, based on the angle of the light.

comment.author: 48261296@N00
comment._content: Wow, what a neat photo, and great find. My mother's family was from this town, but immigrated to the US before WW2.

comment.author: 7860919@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sverreb] I just discovered my great grandparents photo (circa 1905) taken by Louise Engen. Thank you for the information.
